note: Core weapons only. For fuel-as-currency, salvage tables, jury-rig construction, and wasteland hazards, see the full Rust & Ruin supplement.

vehicles.name: Survivor Pickup
vehicles.desc: A pre-war pickup truck with scrap metal bolted to the doors, chicken wire over the windows, and enough engine left to outrun most things on the broken roads. She's the baseline vehicle of the wasteland — common, repairable, and just tough enough to survive another day.
vehicles.notes: The survivor pickup is your default wasteland vehicle. Every settlement has one, every scavenger drives one. She's the starting vehicle for new campaigns — functional, unremarkable, and endlessly modifiable. Let players customise her as the campaign progresses.

vehicles.name: War Rig
vehicles.desc: A freight truck turned mobile fortress. Armoured cab, weapon mounts, and enough cargo capacity to carry a community's water supply for a month. She's the most valuable vehicle in any wasteland convoy and every raider's ultimate prize.
vehicles.notes: The war rig is your convoy centrepiece. She carries what communities need to survive. Chase scenarios revolve around protecting or capturing her. She's slow but nearly unstoppable — ramming through roadblocks is standard operating procedure.

vehicles.name: Interceptor
vehicles.desc: A muscle car stripped for speed and armed for war. Supercharged engine, improvised weapons, and a driver who considers tomorrow an optimistic concept. She's personal — every interceptor is unique, built from whatever the wasteland provides.
vehicles.notes: The interceptor is your player car. She's fast, fragile, and deeply personal. Losing her hurts. Let each player design their own interceptor — the vehicle is an extension of the character.

vehicles.name: Death Bike
vehicles.desc: A motorcycle festooned with spikes, blades, and the skull of something that was probably an animal. She's fast, she's loud, and her rider fights with the gleeful recklessness of someone who stopped caring about survival three settlements ago.
vehicles.notes: Death bikes come in packs. Use them as raider outriders — they harass the convoy, their riders leap onto moving vehicles, and they create chaos that the heavier raider vehicles exploit. They're theatrical cannon fodder.

vehicles.name: Scrap Crawler
vehicles.desc: A tracked vehicle built from construction equipment and tank parts, welded together by someone who values armour over aesthetics. She's slow, she's ugly, and nothing the average raider carries can scratch her paint — if she had any paint left.
vehicles.notes: The scrap crawler is your wasteland heavy. She shrugs off improvised weapons and small arms. The players need explosives, fire, or creative tactics to deal with her. She's the warlord's ride.

vehicles.name: Buzz Buggy
vehicles.desc: A dune buggy stripped to the frame with a roll cage and a mounted weapon. She's fast over sand and dirt, nimble enough to dodge between wrecks, and cheap enough that losing one doesn't bankrupt the war effort.
vehicles.notes: Buzz buggies swarm. Use three to five together, circling larger vehicles and firing from every direction. They're fragile individually but their speed and numbers make them dangerous collectively.

vehicles.name: Thunder Bus
vehicles.desc: An armoured bus full of raiders. She delivers twenty fighters to the ambush site, provides covering fire from roof mounts, and occasionally serves as a rolling roadblock when subtlety fails — which is always.
vehicles.notes: The thunder bus is your enemy troop delivery. She arrives, raiders pour out, and suddenly the players face a horde on foot plus a fortified vehicle. She's also the community transport in peaceful times.

vehicles.name: Sand Yacht
vehicles.desc: A sail-powered vehicle on wheels or skids. She costs no fuel, she's silent, and she crosses flat desert terrain using nothing but wind. She's the poor community's transport — slow, unreliable, and infinitely sustainable.
vehicles.notes: The sand yacht is fuel-free travel. Use her for communities that can't afford petrol. She creates windless-day complications and makes fuel-dependent raiders irrelevant in her territory. Different tactical texture from engine-powered wasteland.

vehicles.name: Fuel Tanker
vehicles.desc: The holiest relic of the wasteland. She carries liquid gold — refined fuel — in a tank that every living person within a hundred miles would kill to possess. She's the reason wars start and the reason communities survive.
vehicles.notes: The fuel tanker is your campaign MacGuffin. Whoever holds her controls the economy. She's also a massive bomb — one incendiary round and everything within a hundred metres dies in a fuel-air explosion. Handle with care, or don't.

vehicles.name: Frankenstein APC
vehicles.desc: Welded together from the hulls of two trucks, a digger, and what might have been a fire engine. She carries ten fighters in a compartment that smells of rust and engine oil, and she's tough enough to absorb hits that would kill anything not built by desperate lunatics with welding torches.
vehicles.notes: The Frankenstein APC is your improvised fighting vehicle. She's hideous, unreliable, and surprisingly effective. She breaks down on a Critical Failure — but her crew knows how to fix her with scavenged parts. She's the wasteland's answer to the Bradley.
